intro: Lycoctonum paishanense, commonly known as the Paishan bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh mountain environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in a fine pubescence, while its stems are slender and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lycoctonum paishanense is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
